channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Wild Update About ‘Slow Horses’ Season 5, 6 And 7 On Apple TV+
item.description: Waiting for Slow Horses season 5? Well, there's some news about that, plus season 6 and 7 as well on Apple TV+.

item.title: The False Sense Of Security In AI Red Teaming
item.description: AI red teaming mostly relies on identifying and patching fixed vulnerabilities, which is a great starting point but not nearly enough.

item.title: How India's GCCs Are Shaping The Future Of Global Enterprises
item.description: India has emerged as the nucleus of the global GCC ecosystem. This didn’t happen overnight, and it didn’t happen by chance.

item.title: What It Means To Be 'AI-Ready'
item.description: It seems worth exploring what being AI-ready truly entails, why so many organizations are searching for it and how to take meaningful steps toward ach...

item.title: ‘Cyberpunk 2077’ Is The Switch 2’s #2 Launch Game
item.description: In the US, Cyberpunk 2077 is the second best-selling game both in the eShop and in terms of physical copies moved.

item.title: Orange cars
item.description: In a given neighborhood, just about all the cars are the same. There are few that are pink, orange or purple, for example. There’s nothing inherently ...

item.title: The power of a pause
item.description: The single-most effective way to invest 90 seconds a day is simple (and difficult). 18 times a day, when you’re about to offer advice, ask a question ...

item.title: Rigor and curiosity
item.description: Kids grow up with innate curiosity. It’s the hardwired instinct that permits us to walk, talk and survive long before we get to school. And at school,...

item.title: What do you need more of?
item.description: If our day (and our work) would get better if we had more: …we know where to get it. If not, then why are we spending our magical attention there?

item.title: Status (and the grass tax)
item.description: Status shows up whenever humans do, and it is the invisible underpinning of our culture. The front lawn was only invented around the time of Columbus....
